item.title: Alicia add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "A nation that continues year after year to spend more money on military defense than on programs of social uplift is approaching spiritual doom." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Alicia add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
<i>[Thanksgiving Day Proclamation, 1963]</i>" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Alicia add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.
<i>[Inaugural Address, January 20 1961]</i>" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Discourage litigation. Persuade your neighbors to compromise whenever you can. As a peacemaker the lawyer has superior opportunity of being a good man. There will still be business enough." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Angry people are not always wise." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alicia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning..." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "If America leads a blessed life, then why did God put all of our oil under people who hate us?" -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Live simply so others may simply live." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I had rather be shut up in a very modest cottage with my books, my family and a few old friends, dining on simple bacon, and letting the world roll on as it liked, than to occupy the most splendid post, which any human power can give." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Jimmy Carter
item.description: "We should live our lives as though Christ was coming this afternoon." -- Jimmy Carter

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Alicia add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Alicia add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi
